name: 3rd International Conference on Political Sciences
content: Connect and Network with the Best Minds in Political Science at the 3rd International Conference on Political Sciences, an interdisciplinary forum for academics, researchers, and practitioners to address contemporary problems and challenges in governance and politics, share ideas, and present research findings. The conference, which will take place in London, United Kingdom, from July 18–20, 2025, intends to offer a setting for thoughtful discussion, perceptive analysis, and lively discussion on a variety of subjects, including public policy and political theory as well as international relations and comparative politics. What You’ll Experience Flexible Presentation Formats: Whether you prefer to present in person or virtually, we’ve got you covered. Choose the format that best suits your needs and engage with peers from around the world. The POLITICALSCIENCES will be an in-person event and will also include live-stream Virtual component for those who cannot join physically but wish to learn, and connect. In-Person participants and speakers will get Letter of Invitation after registration. Keynote Speakers: Gain insights from experts. Their experiences and knowledge will inspire you to elevate your practices and strategies. Publication Opportunities: All accepted papers will be published in the Conference Proceedings, with an ISSN Number. Plus, there are chances to have your work featured in top indexed journals. Who Should Attend? • Academics and Scholars: Professors, researchers, and graduate students in political science. • Policy Makers and Government Officials: Elected officials and civil servants looking to enhance their political knowledge. • Practitioners and Professionals: Political consultants and lobbyists seeking insights into political dynamics. • Students and Young Professionals: Undergraduate students and early-career individuals exploring career paths. • Journalists and Media Professionals: Reporters covering political events and issues. • Nonprofit and NGO Representatives: Advocates and activists focused on social and political issues. Additional Highlights Complimentary city tour of London: Participants will join a complimentary city tour of London, designed specifically for attendees of the Political Science Conference! This engaging experience offers a unique opportunity to connect with fellow participants and gain insights into the political landscape of one of the world's most influential cities.
